title: Deprecation warnings after fresh install
body:
* py-evm Version: x.x.x

Latest master on `6aa10e54`

* OS: osx/linux/win

Linux

* Python Version (python --version):

$ python --version

Python 3.6.5

* Environment (output of `pip freeze`):

### What is wrong?

This happens on latest master after I create a fresh virtualenv and install dependencies via `pip install -e .[dev]`

```
    INFO  10-07 13:03:29               trinity  
      ______     _       _ __       
     /_  __/____(_)___  (_) /___  __
      / / / ___/ / __ \/ / __/ / / /
     / / / /  / / / / / / /_/ /_/ / 
    /_/ /_/  /_/_/ /_/_/\__/\__, /  
                           /____/   
    INFO  10-07 13:03:29               trinity  Trinity/eth-0.2.0a33/linux/cpython3.6.5
    INFO  10-07 13:03:29               trinity  Trinity DEBUG log file is created at /home/cburgdorf/.local/share/trinity/mainnet/logs/trinity.log
    INFO  10-07 13:03:29               trinity  Started DB server process (pid=32481)
/home/cburgdorf/Documents/hacking/ef/py-evm/venv3/lib/python3.6/site.py:165: DeprecationWarning: 'U' mode is deprecated
  f = open(fullname, "rU")
/home/cburgdorf/Documents/hacking/ef/py-evm/venv3/lib/python3.6/importlib/_bootstrap.py:219: ImportWarning: can't resolve package from __spec__ or __package__, falling back on __name__ and __path__
  return f(*args, **kwds)
/home/cburgdorf/Documents/hacking/ef/py-evm/venv3/lib/python3.6/importlib/_bootstrap.py:219: ImportWarning: can't resolve package from __spec__ or __package__, falling back on __name__ and __path__
  return f(*args, **kwds)
    INFO  10-07 13:03:32               trinity  Started networking process (pid=32485)
    INFO  10-07 13:03:32         PluginManager  Plugin started: JSON-RPC Server
/home/cburgdorf/Documents/hacking/ef/py-evm/venv3/lib/python3.6/site.py:165: DeprecationWarning: 'U' mode is deprecated
  f = open(fullname, "rU")
/home/cburgdorf/Documents/hacking/ef/py-evm/venv3/lib/python3.6/site.py:165: DeprecationWarning: 'U' mode is deprecated
  f = open(fullname, "rU")
/home/cburgdorf/Documents/hacking/ef/py-evm/venv3/lib/python3.6/importlib/_bootstrap.py:219: ImportWarning: can't resolve package from __spec__ or __package__, falling back on __name__ and __path__
  return f(*args, **kwds)
/home/cburgdorf/Documents/hacking/ef/py-evm/venv3/lib/python3.6/importlib/_bootstrap.py:219: ImportWarning: can't resolve package from __spec__ or __package__, falling back on __name__ and __path__
  return f(*args, **kwds)
    INFO  10-07 13:03:33  BasePlugin#JSON-RPC Server  JSON-RPC Server started
/home/cburgdorf/Documents/hacking/ef/py-evm/venv3/lib/python3.6/importlib/_bootstrap.py:219: ImportWarning: can't resolve package from __spec__ or __package__, falling back on __name__ and __path__
  return f(*args, **kwds)
/home/cburgdorf/Documents/hacking/ef/py-evm/venv3/lib/python3.6/importlib/_bootstrap.py:219: ImportWarning: can't resolve package from __spec__ or __package__, falling back on __name__ and __path__
  return f(*args, **kwds)
/home/cburgdorf/Documents/hacking/ef/py-evm/venv3/lib/python3.6/site.py:165: DeprecationWarning: 'U' mode is deprecated
  f = open(fullname, "rU")
    INFO  10-07 13:03:33             IPCServer  IPC started at: /home/cburgdorf/.local/share/trinity/mainnet/jsonrpc.ipc
/home/cburgdorf/Documents/hacking/ef/py-evm/venv3/lib/python3.6/site.py:165: DeprecationWarning: 'U' mode is deprecated
  f = open(fullname, "rU")
/home/cburgdorf/Documents/hacking/ef/py-evm/venv3/lib/python3.6/site.py:165: DeprecationWarning: 'U' mode is deprecated
  f = open(fullname, "rU")
/home/cburgdorf/Documents/hacking/ef/py-evm/venv3/lib/python3.6/site.py:165: DeprecationWarning: 'U' mode is deprecated

  f = open(fullname, "rU")

  f = open(fullname, "rU")
```


### How can it be fixed

:see_no_evil: :hear_no_evil:

Ok, noticed that this is due to https://github.com/ethereum/py-evm/commit/92c02d7e0550a3de46838f681e3ac3233acc6483 which turned on warnings by default. Anyway, leaving this open to follow up on the deprecation warnings for us to figure out how to migrate to non-deprecated APIs.
How about a single meta-issue #1370 . We can make one-off issues for every warning, and link to it. (and bounty it)
